page.title: 05FARMING IN ASHBY MAGNA
page.content:
Farming in the area is a mixture of beef and dairy cattle, sheep, pigs and poultry. There is a fish farm for breeding trout to stock farms for competitive fishing. Hay is grown to feed stock over the winter together with barley, oats and corn for cereal. there is some oil seed rape produced as cattle feed but virutally no root crops are grown
The majority of farms are small between 3O and 8O acres with the largest being no more than 2OO acres.
Hubbards Farm in Ashby Magna is run as a Government Youth Training Scheme in order to train young people between the ages of l6 and l8 to work in the farming industry.
